noun.description: A genus of pliosaurs, the type of the family Pliosauridae; (also pliosaurus) a pliosaur of this genus.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Richard Owen (1804–1892), comparative anatomist and palaeontologist. From scientific Latin Pleiosaurus, genus name from pleio- + -saurus, so called because the genus is closer to the saurian type than Ichthyosaurus.
